snippet: States should invest in public services and education, not subsidize big business by giving them billions a year in tax breaks.
abstract: Editorial urges states and cities to invest in public services and education, rather than subsidizing big business by giving tax breaks; observes that according to New York Times investigation, states have tried to lure large companies by using subsidies in hopes that companies will create jobs, which rarely works as intended.
lead_paragraph: States should invest in public services and education, not subsidize big business by giving them billions a year in tax breaks.
